page.title: 14Social Concerns.
page.content: I saw the news programme about the famine in Ethiopia. I thought that it was terrible that I had so much food and comfort in my home, while the children in Ethiopia were starving. I asked my mother if I could set a stall up outside my house and sell some of my books and toys to raise money to buy food for Ethiopia.My mum said that I would raise more money if I had a jumble sale at school. So the next day I asked Mrs.Walker, my head mistress if I could ask all the children in Newport School to bring jumble, books and toys to school on Saturday morning.All my friends thought it was a good idea.We made over a hundred pounds on that Saturday which amazed me.I only thought we would make a few pounds.We bought high enery biscuits with the money and sent them to Ethiopia. Clare Hardcastle.
